<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Wolf Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=437) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=112" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=152" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 159 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

**Archetype** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 4)

**Requirements**
You are unarmored.

</column>

---

You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fanged teeth. You can make wolf jaw unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 piercing damage; are in the brawling group; and have the agile, backstabber, finesse, nonlethal, and unarmed traits.

 If you’re flanking a target while in Wolf Stance, your wolf jaw unarmed attacks also gain the trip trait.

<title level="2">Wolf Stance leads to...</title>
[Wolf Drag](/Feats.aspx?ID=457)
name: Wolf Stance
